trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory Integration with xMatters OnDemand | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory Integration with xMatters OnDemand | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use xMatters OnDemand with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use xMatters OnDemand with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and xMatters OnDemand.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and xMatters OnDemand.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A xMatters OnDemand tenant
trans-unit.target: A xMatters OnDemand tenant

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to xMatters OnDemand will be able to single sign into the application at your xMatters OnDemand company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to xMatters OnDemand will be able to single sign into the application at your xMatters OnDemand company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for xMatters OnDemand
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for xMatters OnDemand

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for xMatters OnDemand.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for xMatters OnDemand.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type xMatters OnDemand.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type xMatters OnDemand.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select XMatters OnDemand, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select XMatters OnDemand, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>xMatters OnDemand</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>xMatters OnDemand</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to XMatters OnDemand with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to XMatters OnDemand with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the XMatters OnDemand application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the XMatters OnDemand application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to XMatters OnDemand page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to XMatters OnDemand page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the XMatters OnDemand Sign In URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "https://\.XMattersOnDemandapp.com", and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the XMatters OnDemand Sign In URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "https://\.XMattersOnDemandapp.com", and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure app URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure app URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at XMatters OnDemand page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally as c:\\XMatters OnDemand.cer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at XMatters OnDemand page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally as c:\\XMatters OnDemand.cer.

trans-unit.source: You need to forward the certificate to the xMatters support team.
trans-unit.target: You need to forward the certificate to the xMatters support team.

trans-unit.source: The certificate needs to be uploaded by the xMatters support team before you can finalize the single sign-on configuration.
trans-unit.target: The certificate needs to be uploaded by the xMatters support team before you can finalize the single sign-on configuration.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your XMatters OnDemand company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your XMatters OnDemand company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: In the toolbar on the top, click Admin, and then click Company Details in the navigation bar on the left side.
trans-unit.target: In the toolbar on the top, click Admin, and then click Company Details in the navigation bar on the left side.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Admin</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Admin</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the SAML Configuration page, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the SAML Configuration page, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SAML configuration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SAML configuration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select Enable SAML.
trans-unit.target: Select Enable SAML.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at XMatters OnDemand dialog page, copy the Identity Provider ID value, and then paste it into the Identity Provider ID textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at XMatters OnDemand dialog page, copy the Identity Provider ID value, and then paste it into the Identity Provider ID textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at XMatters OnDemand dialog page, copy the Single Sign-On Service URL value, and then paste it into the Single Sign On URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at XMatters OnDemand dialog page, copy the Single Sign-On Service URL value, and then paste it into the Single Sign On URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at XMatters OnDemand dialog page, copy the Single Sign-Out Service URL value, and then paste it into the Single Logout URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at XMatters OnDemand dialog page, copy the Single Sign-Out Service URL value, and then paste it into the Single Logout URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: On the Company Details page, at the top, click Save Changes.
trans-unit.target: On the Company Details page, at the top, click Save Changes.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Company details</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Company details</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into XMatters OnDemand, they must be provisioned into XMatters OnDemand.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into XMatters OnDemand, they must be provisioned into XMatters OnDemand.

trans-unit.source: In the case of XMatters OnDemand, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of XMatters OnDemand, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: Log in to your XMatters OnDemand tenant.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your XMatters OnDemand tenant.

trans-unit.source: Click the Users tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the Users tab.

trans-unit.source: Click Add User.
trans-unit.target: Click Add User.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select Active.
trans-unit.target: Select Active.

trans-unit.source: In the Add a User section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the Add a User section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add a User</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add a User</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enter the UserID, First name, Last name, Site of a valid AAD account you want to provision.
trans-unit.target: Enter the UserID, First name, Last name, Site of a valid AAD account you want to provision.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other XMatters OnDemand user account creation tools or APIs provided by XMatters OnDemand to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other XMatters OnDemand user account creation tools or APIs provided by XMatters OnDemand to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the XMatters OnDemand **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the XMatters OnDemand **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
